definition: Ban Ki Moon (1944-), Korean diplomat, UN secretary-general 2007-2016
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
base/foundation/basic/radical (chemistry)/(slang) gay
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki- moon has also extended his condolences.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文也对巴西火灾遇难者表示哀悼。

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon sent a congratulatory message to the conference.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文向大会发来贺信。

sentences.english: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon described the queen as an anchor for our age.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文称女王为这个时代的中流砥柱。

sentences.english: Ban Ki-moon speaks at the Bali climate change conference in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文在2007年的巴厘岛气候变化会议上发言。

sentences.english: Ban also said it was time for Israel to consider a unilateral ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文也说现在是时候让以色列考虑单方面的停战。

sentences.english: In addition to Korean, Mr. Ban speaks English and French.
sentences.chinese: 除韩国语外，潘基文先生还讲英语和法语。

sentences.english: Mr. Ban said the two challenges demand an unprecedented response.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文说，这两项挑战需要人类做出前所未有的回应。

sentences.english: Conveniently enough, Mr Ban will not be around.
sentences.chinese: 巧的是，潘基文刚好不在。

sentences.english: Mr. Ban will be in Burma on Thursday and Friday.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文将于星期四和星期五访问缅甸。

sentences.english: The United Nations report was prepared for Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
sentences.chinese: 这份联合国报告是为联合国秘书长潘基文准备的。

sentences.english: Ban said earlier this month that he wanted a second term.
sentences.chinese: 在本月初，潘基文表示连任意愿。

sentences.english: From Barack Obama to Ban Ki Moon everyone has realized that India has finally arrived.
sentences.chinese: 从奥巴马到潘基文都提到印度取得的成就。

sentences.english: For the new one, Ban Ki-moon, it seems to be the environment and natural resources. Last year he threw his weight behind a declaration in Bali on climate change.
sentences.chinese: 而对于新任的潘基文，焦点似乎是在环境与资源上。

sentences.english: The most notable monkey in world politics is Ban.
sentences.chinese: 潘基文是世界政坛最著名的肖猴者。

sentences.english: The Japanese prime minister is scheduled to meet with Mr. Ban on Wednesday.
sentences.chinese: 预计日本首相将于星期三会晤潘基文。

sentences.english: U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon welcomed the announcement.
sentences.chinese: 联合国秘书长潘基文对这项宣布表示欢迎。

definition: Moon Jae-in (1953-), Korean politician and human rights lawyer, president of Korea from 2017
António Guterres (1949-), secretary-general of the United Nations (2017-), prime minister of Portugal (1995-2002)
Blue House (Cheong Wa Dae), residence of the president of South Korea in Seoul
Kim Dae-jung (1926-2009), South Korea politician, president 1998-2003, Nobel peace prize laureate 2000
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
Mike Pence (1959-), US Republican politician, US vice president from 2017
Roh Moo-hyun (1946-2009), South Korean lawyer and politician, president 2003-2008
former president
Lee Myung-bak (1941-), South Korean businessman, one-time chairman of Hyundai, president of South Korea 2008-2013
Park Geun-hye (1952-), Korean politician, daughter of former dictator Park Chung-Hee 朴正熙[Piao2 Zheng4 xi1], president of Korea 2013-2017
opposition party
Abe (Japanese surname)
Kim Young-sam (1927-), South Korean politician, president 1993-1998
South Korean Grand national party
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
